intro: Siphoneranthemum lilacinum, commonly known as the lilac-flowered siphoneranthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, lilac-colored blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Siphoneranthemum lilacinum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
